Description: Fragment of lip, wall and handle-root sherd (mended from five fragments) of East Greek pottery bowl (rosette bowl?); fine orange clay with much silver mica; interior glazed dark brown with two added red bands lined in white; exterior: top of lip glazed; two sets of pendent rays on either side of handle with two painted bands below; inscription cut on lower wall, in reserved zone.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, no. 304)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 669, no. 265)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.290)
